tao voyages to Annedion nny 5th mats NOITROLS @) 177 1/2; 1st mate London to America 1y
7m; 3rd mate NORFOLK (3) 1775/6 (approved 20 Oct 1775, aged 28); d 17 Sep 1776

4th mate DUKE OF PORTLAND 1769/70

surgeon GENES C1) 1776/7; Madras Asst Surgeon 20 Way 1786, remained in Benga1 and did not
join; struck off 29 Ju1 1788

b in Eng1and; seaman DUTTON (1) 1764/5; midshipman NORTHUMBERLAND (2) 1766/7;
midshipman NORFOLK (2) 1768/9; 6th mate DUTTON (1) 1770/1, transf as 5th mate to
LONDON (12) 17 Dec 1771; 2nd mate Grosvenor to America 6m; 4th mate GRENVILLE
1774/5 (approved 21 Feb 1775, aged 24); 3rd mate LORD NORTH 1776/7; 2nd mate LORD
NORTH 1780/1; 2nd mate FOULIS 1783/4; 1st mate FOULIS 1785/6; 1st mate
HILLSBOROUGH (2) 1789/90 & 1792/3; Capt HILLSBOROUGH (2) 1794/5 & 1796/7

6m; examined as 2nd mate SWALLOW (3) packet 31 Mar 1786, aged 23, not qua1ified

Saris, John (c1579-1643)
b 1579 or 1580, ygr s of Thomas, of London, & his 1st wife Katherine, dau of Edward Love11;
factor in Second Voyage 1603/4; served at Bantam unti1 4 Oct 1609, returned to Eng1and in
HECTOR; Genera1 of Eighth Voyage 1610/1, sett1ed factory in Japan 1613; mc1615 Anne dau
of Wi11iam Meggs of Whitechape1 (she d without issue 21 Feb 1623, bur St Boto1ph Thames St);
moved to Church Row, Fu1ham, c1629; d there 11 Dec 1643, bur 19 Dec Fu1ham parish church
See Dictionary of Nationa1 Biography
